title: If it doesn't matter if you win or lose, then why even try to win? - Quora

Think of it like life. There isn't anything that says you have to try to win and there isn't anything that will provide a roadmap to be followed to lead a life. But the effort put into competing and the journey through your life will reveal much about you. When you don't win or when life may not go ike anyone could ever have told you (only you'll know your life) the outcome itself won't matter (win or lose) it's how you play the game (traversing through your existence).

A great martial artist, Chen Man Ching, would never fight someone, if he thought he would win. He fought only when he was convinced that he would lose. He learned nothing from winning. He learned only when he lost. So, he coined the phrase, “Invest in loss.” The only real competition you ever enter is the one with yourself. That is the only one you need to win. Every other competition in which you ever participate — win, lose, or draw — is preparing you for that one effort. Some people never figure this out.

That old saying is some “Feel good” bull. One must first decide if competing in whatever endeavor will help you or another person in some meaningful way? If your answer is “No” then be a spectator. If your truest answer to yourself is “Yes” however: Then, second, train your brain first to WIN. Picture and envision winning. The body will follow what the brain tells it most every time when adrenaline starts pumping! If you put me in a cake baking contest, I will probably be the “Cut up” comedian at last place right? You wanna’ chase a fugitive and give me a signed FTA warrant from a judge? That turkey is going to lose. Finally, be humble in your wins because they were righteously earned! Hope that helps,ADR

It matters to win if you are playing a game because thats the goal. You are told it doesn’t matter after you lose the game so you don’t feel bad about it. To be honest, it feels good to win and it feels bad to lose but you shouldn’t take it to heart either way. If you lose, you work harder and push yourself more. Putting in the effort is more important than anything. Your personal best is what should matter. Some people are better at one thing than another. You don’t know what that is until you have put everything into it. We are all endowed with our own specific talants. Find what you are good at but more important is to find what you enjoy doing. Usually they are the same. I sucked at baseball but I always enjoyed playing. Didn’t care if I sucked.

In some things it matters, but in others it doesn’t. Most humans have to learn a whole lot more before they can even start to understand the different situations well enough. It seems you have a lot of learning to do. So, change teachers and start learning the important things! A majority of humans accept the nonsense that they are taught by those controlled by the powerful and very rich; but those do not teach Truth and there is Truth in this marvelous universe. Some prefer to learn from fools; but that does not lead to a life of Love, Joy and Peace. Find and choose better teachers!

Because satisfaction can be gained from any of the outcomes. If you don't win it gives you the opportunity to examine your game for flaws AND it allows you to examine how somebody of at least equal skill level goes about things. Winning is always fun, but you rarely learn anything from roflstomping your opponent.
We will all lose, in the end, and by losing, we will win. To quote that short green Jedi master, “Is no try. Is only do.”
For the challenge to better yourself and self-esteem if you win hey if you don't you gave it your best and you can still be proud
It DOES matter if you win. But win with humility and lose with grace. To compete in fair competition is one of the essences of existence.
